news.title: Catherine Connolly: "I think we have to unite. We’re a tiny country. We should have never been divided"
news.summary: Read the full interview in the current issue of Hot Press, out now.

news.title: Gaza aid flotilla carrying multiple Irish activists reports second drone attack at Tunisian port
news.summary: Cork comedian and activist Tadhg Hickey was on board the boat that was struck. Novelist Naoise Dolan, human rights activist Caoimhe Butterly, poet Sarah Clancy and multiple Oireachtas members also participated in the flotilla.

news.title: Student Special: The Ultimate College Commute Playlist
news.summary: As part of our Student Special, Jenna Thompson selects some essential tunes to while away those journeys to and from class.

news.title: September A&R Department: Anamoe Drive, Burglar, Jordan Kelly and more
news.summary: Grunge-inclined Dublin duo Burglar lead this month's new Irish music charge.

news.title: CMAT and Fontaines D.C. score nominations for Mercury Prize
news.summary: The overall winner of the prestigious prize will be revealed in Newcastle next month.

news.title: Wolf Alice share video for ‘Just Two Girls’
news.summary: They will play the 3Arena on December 10.

news.title: Watch: CMAT performs 'Take A Sexy Picture of Me' on Jimmy Kimmel Live
news.summary: The singer performed her Euro-Country hit, 'Take A Sexy Picture Of Me'.

news.title: Shame: "When has music not been political?"
news.summary: Backstage at Collins Barracks, Shame sit down to discuss their “back to basics” new album Cutthroat, Louis Walsh, Oscar Wilde, and why “standing up for what you believe in is just the bare minimum you can do...”

news.title: DUG announce Ireland and UK tour dates
news.summary: Their debut album Have At It! drops on September 19.
